story-context.acceptanceCriteria:
### AC-1: Production Build Successful **Given** the application has been tested and is ready for deployment **When** running the production build command **Then**: - `npm run build` completes successfully with exit code 0 - Production bundle created in `/dist` folder - TypeScript compilation completes without errors - Build output shows minified JavaScript, purged CSS, hashed filenames, source maps - Bundle size reasonable (<1MB, preferably <700KB) - No build warnings or errors - Build completes in <60 seconds (NFR-P2)
### AC-2: Local Production Preview Verified **Given** production build completed successfully **When** running `npm run preview` **Then**: - Preview server starts at http://localhost:4173 - Application loads and functions correctly in production mode - All features work (Transaction CRUD, Dashboard, Filtering, Navigation, LocalStorage) - No console errors - Performance acceptable (page load <3s) - Styling correct (Tailwind classes applied)
### AC-3: Hosting Platform Configured **Given** application ready for deployment **When** setting up hosting platform (Netlify or Vercel) **Then**: - Account created on hosting platform (Netlify recommended) - GitHub repository connected via OAuth - Build settings configured: Build command `npm run build`, Publish dir `smartbudget/dist` or `dist`, Node 20.x/22.x - Environment variables configured (none expected for MVP) - SPA routing configured via redirects (netlify.toml or Vercel auto-detect) - Automatic deploys enabled from `main` branch (CI/CD)
### AC-4: Initial Deployment Successful **Given** hosting platform configured **When** triggering first deployment **Then**: - Deployment completes within 5 minutes (NFR-P3) - Build logs show: Repository cloned, Dependencies installed, Build successful, Assets uploaded - Deployment status "Success" or "Published" - Public production URL generated (e.g., `https://smartbudget-deyvid.netlify.app`) - No deployment errors - Deploy logs accessible
### AC-5: Application Functions in Production **Given** application deployed to production URL **When** accessing via public URL **Then**: - Application loads successfully - HTTPS enforced - All features work: Dashboard, Transactions CRUD, Filtering, Navigation, LocalStorage, Responsive - SPA routing works (direct URLs don't 404) - No console errors - Error boundaries work gracefully
### AC-6: Performance Meets Requirements in Production **Given** application deployed and functional **When** testing performance on production URL **Then** (per PRD NFR-1): - Initial page load: <3s on 3G - UI interactions: <100ms response - Chart rendering: <2s - Filter operations: <500ms - Lighthouse Performance score >80 - Production build optimized (minified, tree-shaken, code-split) - CDN delivery fast
### AC-7: Production URL Documented **Given** application successfully deployed **When** updating project documentation **Then**: - Production URL added to README.md (Live Demo link, Deployment section) - GitHub repository "About" section updated (Website field, Description) - Production URL added to prompts.md - README deployment section includes actual URL, automatic deploys note, deployment instructions
### AC-8: Deployment Process Validated **Given** deployment complete **When** validating deployment workflow **Then**: - Manual test: Code change → commit → push to main - Automatic deployment triggers within 1 minute - New deployment completes successfully - Changes visible on production URL within 5 minutes - Deploy preview URLs work - Rollback capability verified - Deployment history visible - Build logs accessible
### AC-9: Cross-Browser Production Testing **Given** application deployed to production **When** testing on multiple browsers **Then** (as verified in Story 6.1): - Chrome 90+: All features work - Firefox 88+: All features work - Safari 14+: All features work - Mobile browsers: iOS Safari, Chrome Android work - No browser-specific bugs - Consistent UX across browsers - LocalStorage works in all browsers
### AC-10: Production Deployment Complete **Given** all previous ACs met **When** finalizing deployment **Then**: - Application publicly accessible 24/7 (99.9% uptime) - No P0/P1 bugs in production - Performance requirements met (NFR-1) - Security requirements met (HTTPS, no exposed secrets) - README and GitHub repo updated with production URL - Deployment process documented - PRD success criteria met: "Public GitHub repository" ✓, "Deployed, accessible application" ✓ - Production URL ready for demonstration

story-context.constraints:
**Deployment Constraints:** - No source code modifications allowed - this is deployment/documentation only - Must use static hosting (Netlify or Vercel) - no backend/server deployment - Production build must be tested locally before deploying (AC-1, AC-2) - Build must complete in <60 seconds (NFR-P2) - Deployment must complete in <5 minutes (NFR-P3) - HTTPS must be enforced (automatic with Netlify/Vercel) - No environment variables needed for MVP (LocalStorage only, no backend)
**Architecture Constraints:** - No architectural changes allowed (Epic 6 constraint) - Application is feature-complete from Epics 1-5 - Build process uses existing Vite configuration (no changes) - SPA routing requires redirect rules (netlify.toml already configured) - Node.js 20.19+ or 22.12+ required for Vite 6.x build
**Security Constraints:** - No secrets or API keys in code (none exist in MVP) - .env files must not be committed (already in .gitignore) - HTTPS enforced on production URL (automatic) - No hardcoded credentials in commit history - Source maps acceptable for open-source educational project
**Performance Constraints (NFR-1):** - Initial page load: <3 seconds on 3G connection - UI interactions: <100ms response time - Chart rendering: <2 seconds - Filter operations: <500ms - Bundle size: <1MB (preferably <700KB), <200KB gzipped - Lighthouse Performance score: >80
**Testing Constraints:** - All features must work identically in production as development - Cross-browser testing required: Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Safari 14+, Mobile - No P0 or P1 bugs allowed in production (verified in Story 6.1) - LocalStorage persistence must work across browsers - Direct URL access must not 404 (SPA routing requirement)
**Documentation Constraints:** - Production URL must be added to README.md (AC-7) - GitHub repository "About" section must include production URL (AC-7) - Deployment instructions must be accurate and tested (AC-7) - Automatic deploys must be documented in README (AC-7)
story-context.interfaces:
**Build & Deployment Interface (npm scripts):** - `npm run build` → TypeScript compile + Vite production build → outputs to /dist - Expected output: "✓ built in Xs" message, /dist folder created - Build time: ~25 seconds (tested in Story 6.1) - Bundle size: ~614 KB (~184 KB gzipped) - `npm run preview` → Preview production build locally - Starts server at: http://localhost:4173 - Use to verify build before deployment
**Netlify Deployment Interface (netlify.toml):** ```toml [build] command = "npm run build" publish = "dist"
[[redirects]] from = "/*" to = "/index.html" status = 200 # SPA routing (rewrite, not redirect) ```
**Netlify Platform Interface:** - Authentication: GitHub OAuth - Repository connection: Select "Exam - Smart Budget Application" - Build settings: Base dir (smartbudget if monorepo), Build command, Publish dir - Deploy trigger: Automatic on push to main branch - Output: Production URL (e.g., https://smartbudget-deyvid.netlify.app)
**Vercel Deployment Interface (Alternative):** ```json { "buildCommand": "npm run build", "outputDirectory": "dist", "framework": "vite", "rewrites": [ { "source": "/(.*)", "destination": "/index.html" } ] } ``` Note: Vercel auto-detects Vite projects - may not need vercel.json
**Production Application Interface:** - URL: https://.netlify.app or https://.vercel.app - Protocol: HTTPS (enforced automatically) - Routing: Client-side (React Router) via SPA redirects - Data: LocalStorage (browser-based, no backend API) - CDN: Global edge locations for fast asset delivery
**GitHub Repository Interface (for documentation updates):** - README.md: Add production URL to: - Top section: `[Live Demo](https://...)` badge/link - Deployment section: Actual production URL with instructions - GitHub Settings → About: - Website field: Production URL - Description: Mention "Live demo available"
**Performance Testing Interface (Lighthouse):** - Chrome DevTools → Lighthouse tab - Run audit: Performance, Accessibility, Best Practices, SEO - Target: Performance score >80 - Metrics: FCP, LCP, TTI, TBT, CLS
**Deployment History Interface:** - Netlify/Vercel dashboard shows: - List of all deployments with timestamps - Deployment status (Success, Failed, Building) - Build logs for each deployment - Rollback option to previous successful deployment - Deploy preview URLs (for PRs, if enabled)

tests.standards:
**Deployment Testing Standards:**
**Pre-Deployment Testing (Local):** - Run `npm run build` successfully (AC-1) - Verify /dist folder created with expected structure - Check bundle size (<700KB total, <200KB gzipped) - Run `npm run preview` and test all features (AC-2) - Verify no console errors in production mode - Test LocalStorage persistence in preview
**Production Deployment Testing:** - Initial deployment successful (AC-4) - Production URL accessible via HTTPS (AC-5) - All features functional in production (AC-5) - SPA routing works (direct URLs don't 404) (AC-5) - Cross-browser testing (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Mobile) (AC-9) - Performance testing (Lighthouse >80, load <3s, interactions <100ms) (AC-6) - Automatic deployment workflow validated (AC-8)
**Performance Testing Standards (NFR-1 from PRD):** - Initial page load: <3 seconds on 3G connection (simulated in DevTools) - UI interactions: <100ms response time (button clicks, form inputs) - Chart rendering: <2 seconds (Dashboard pie chart and trend chart) - Filter operations: <500ms (period selector, category filter, search) - Lighthouse Performance score: >80/100 - Bundle size verification: <1MB total, <200KB gzipped
**Cross-Browser Testing Standards:** - Chrome 90+ (desktop): All features work, no console errors - Firefox 88+ (desktop): All features work, no console errors - Safari 14+ (macOS): All features work, no console errors - iOS Safari (mobile): All features work, responsive design correct - Chrome Android (mobile): All features work, responsive design correct - LocalStorage works in all browsers (including private/incognito where available) - Consistent user experience across all browsers
**Security Testing Standards:** - HTTPS enforced (check URL starts with https://) - No secrets/API keys exposed in code (grep for common patterns) - .env files not committed (check .gitignore) - No console errors revealing sensitive information - Error boundaries work (no application crashes)
**Documentation Testing Standards:** - README.md updated with production URL (AC-7) - GitHub About section updated (AC-7) - Deployment instructions in README are accurate - All links in README resolve correctly - Production URL copy-paste ready

tests.ideas:
**Test Ideas Mapped to Acceptance Criteria:**
**AC-1 (Production Build Successful):** - Run `npm run build` from smartbudget directory → Exit code 0 - Verify /dist folder created with index.html, assets/ subdirectory - Check JavaScript files are minified (inspect file contents) - Verify filenames have hashes (e.g., index-abc123.js) - Measure bundle size (ls -lh dist/assets/ or check build output) - Verify source maps generated (index-abc123.js.map files exist) - Check build time <60 seconds (note timestamp in build output) - Verify no TypeScript errors (tsc -b completes successfully)
**AC-2 (Local Production Preview):** - Run `npm run preview` → Server starts at localhost:4173 - Open browser → Navigate to http://localhost:4173 - Test Dashboard: Summary cards display, pie chart renders, trend chart renders - Test Add Transaction: Form loads, submit creates transaction - Test Edit Transaction: Click edit icon, form populates, save updates transaction - Test Delete Transaction: Click delete, confirm, transaction removed - Test Period Filter: Select "Last Month" → Transactions filter correctly - Test Category Filter: Select category → Transactions filter correctly - Test Search: Type in search box → Transactions filter by description - Test Navigation: Click Dashboard, Transactions links → Pages load - Test LocalStorage: Add transaction, refresh page → Data persists - Check browser console → No errors - Test responsive: Resize browser window → Layout adjusts correctly
**AC-3 (Hosting Platform Configured):** - Create Netlify account → Account dashboard accessible - Connect GitHub → OAuth flow completes, repositories visible - Select repository → "Exam - Smart Budget Application" selected - Configure base directory → "smartbudget" (if monorepo) or blank - Set build command → "npm run build" or "cd smartbudget && npm run build" - Set publish directory → "dist" or "smartbudget/dist" - Set Node version → 20.x (if option available) - Verify netlify.toml detected → Build settings auto-populated - Enable automatic deploys → "Deploy on push to main" enabled - Save configuration → Settings saved successfully
**AC-4 (Initial Deployment Successful):** - Trigger deployment → Click "Deploy site" or push to main - Monitor deployment → Dashboard shows "Building" status - Watch build logs → Repository cloning, npm install, npm run build - Wait for completion → Status changes to "Published" (target: <5 min) - Copy production URL → e.g., https://smartbudget-deyvid.netlify.app - Click production URL → Application loads (initial smoke test) - Check deployment status → No errors, success message displayed
**AC-5 (Application Functions in Production):** - Open production URL in browser → Application loads - Verify HTTPS → URL starts with https:// - Test all features (same as AC-2 but on production URL): - Dashboard displays correctly - Add, edit, delete transactions work - Period filter, category filter, search work - Navigation works (all routes accessible) - LocalStorage persistence works - Responsive design works (mobile, tablet, desktop) - Test direct URL access → https:///transactions loads (no 404) - Check browser console → No errors - Test error boundary → Verify graceful error handling
**AC-6 (Performance Meets Requirements):** - Run Lighthouse audit: DevTools → Lighthouse → Run audit - Performance score >80 - Note FCP, LCP, TTI, TBT, CLS metrics - Test initial page load: - Hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R or Cmd+Shift+R) - Enable DevTools Network throttling: "Slow 3G" - Measure "Load" time in Network tab - Verify <3 seconds - Test UI interaction responsiveness: - Click buttons, links → Measure response time (<100ms) - Type in form inputs → Immediate feedback - Navigate between pages → Instant transition - Test chart rendering: - Clear LocalStorage, add 30 transactions - Navigate to Dashboard - Measure time from navigation to charts fully rendered - Verify <2 seconds - Test filter performance: - Add 50+ transactions - Apply period filter → Measure update time (<500ms) - Apply category filter → Measure update time (<500ms) - Search transactions → Measure update time (<500ms) - Verify production optimizations: - Check Network tab: JS files minified (small file size) - Check Response Headers: Content-Encoding: gzip or br (compression) - Verify assets served from CDN (check Response Headers)
**AC-7 (Production URL Documented):** - Update README.md: - Add live demo link near top: `[Live Demo](https://...)` - Update Deployment section with actual URL - Add note: "Automatic deploys enabled from main branch" - Commit and push changes - Update GitHub repository: - Navigate to repository Settings → General → About - Add production URL to "Website" field - Update "Description" to mention live demo - Click "Save" - Verify links: - Click live demo link in README → Opens production URL - Click website link in GitHub About → Opens production URL
**AC-8 (Deployment Process Validated):** - Make test change: Update README (e.g., add comment) - Commit: `git commit -m "test: Validate automatic deployment"` - Push: `git push origin main` - Monitor hosting platform dashboard: - Deployment triggers within 1 minute - Build completes successfully - Deployment status "Published" - Check production URL: - Changes visible within 5 minutes - Test change appears (e.g., updated README content) - Test rollback: - Navigate to deployment history in platform dashboard - Locate previous deployment - Note "Rollback" or "Publish" button available (don't actually rollback) - Review deployment history: - Multiple deployments visible with timestamps - Build logs accessible for each deployment
**AC-9 (Cross-Browser Production Testing):** - Test Chrome 90+ (desktop): - Open production URL in Chrome - Test all features (Dashboard, Transactions, Filtering, Navigation) - Check console for errors - Verify LocalStorage works - Test Firefox 88+ (desktop): - Open production URL in Firefox - Test all features - Check console for errors - Verify LocalStorage works - Test Safari 14+ (macOS): - Open production URL in Safari - Test all features - Check console for errors - Verify LocalStorage works - Test iOS Safari (mobile): - Open production URL on iPhone or iPad - Test features (touch interactions) - Verify responsive design - Check LocalStorage works - Test Chrome Android (mobile): - Open production URL on Android device - Test features (touch interactions) - Verify responsive design - Check LocalStorage works - Compare experiences: - Consistent UX across all browsers - No browser-specific bugs - All features work identically
**AC-10 (Production Deployment Complete):** - Verify 24/7 accessibility: Test from different network/device → Loads - Verify no P0/P1 bugs: Reference Story 6.1 testing results → All passed - Verify performance: Reference AC-6 Lighthouse results → Score >80 - Verify security: - HTTPS enforced: URL starts with https:// - No secrets exposed: Grep codebase for API keys, passwords → None found - .env not committed: Check Git history → Not present - Verify documentation updated: - README has production URL: Check README.md → URL present - GitHub About updated: Check repository page → URL present - Verify deployment process documented: - README Deployment section: Netlify/Vercel instructions → Documented - Verify PRD success criteria: - "Public GitHub repository": Repository is public → ✓ - "Deployed, accessible application": Production URL works → ✓ - Production ready for demonstration: Share URL with stakeholders
